item.description:
Hi! Everyone, I just found out there is a bike trail that goes from the North Shore Mall, Peabody up to the Ipswich River in Middleton. It's only 7.4 miles in each direction. Since its a short ride Lets try and squeeze it all in as a week night ride. It will be tight since the sun sets at 7pm so wear reflective clothing & make sure you have lighting of some sort. I use my hiking headlamp if I bike when it's getting dark.

The Independence Greenway runs 7.4 miles one way and runs between the Ipswich River and the North Shore Mall. The trail is mostly continuous except for one on-road segment between Peabody Road and Lt. Ross Park. From the park follow Johnson Street to Lowell Street, under US 1 and I-95, and Peabody Road. This 1.4-mile on-street portion does have heavy traffic and some hills. A sidewalk is available.

The rail-trail follows the abandoned Salem and Lowell Railroad and offers nice views. It passes by wetlands and ponds that are home to herons, swans and geese.

We are going to be cutting it tight with the sunset, so be ready to ride and on you bike by 5:30 or meet us at a different trail head.

http://www.peabody-ma.gov/comm_dev/IndependenceGreenwayMap.pdf

Parking and Trail Access
You can access the Independence Greenway at the North Shore Mall trailhead, near 1 Essex Center Drive next to the parking lot for Lahey Clinic Peabody. Face the mall and follow the hospital signs (H) to the trailhead.

I've never done this trail before so bare with me this could be an adventure for all.

Afterwards for those who would like to we shall go to one of the local restaurants like Bugaboo Creek for a bite to eat.
item.name: Independence Greenway-Peabody to Middleton, who knew???
